value:
Though not quite as fine a man as
Eldigan, my brother, Alfonse has
recommendable qualities.$k$pNo doubt, the prince will one day
help Askr become a truly
great realm.

My brother set a high standard for
what is possible in a man. How could
one ever marry, knowing him?

You mustn't ever perish. I have
suffered far too much loss as it is.
I would wither away.

One wonders—if you served a
foolish ruler, would you obey
without question or defy his will?

My brother Eldigan possessed
Mystletainn, the Demon Sword, a
legendary blade in my world.$k$pHe was also known as a lord of
lionhearted courage. I'll never meet
the likes of Eldigan again.

How do you do? Oh, on second
glance, let me answer that. You're
doing surprisingly well here.

No less than one expected.
And yet, no more either.

One isn't used to such
disappointments.

One can only hope to be as
talented as her brother in time.

One wonders—who are you? Not to
mention, what are your intentions?
And what is this curious place?

In my world, my dear brother gave all,
struggling to serve the highest of
knightly ideals.$k$pHow I tried to keep him from being
consumed by his situation.
Tried—and failed.$k$pMy heart has been torn to ribbons,
and those ribbons, to tatters.$k$pDearest, darling Eldie—I mean,
Brother—how I miss you and
your noble bearing.$k$pThough one longs to walk through
life with as superlative a person,
one must carry on.$k$pYou have proven that you, like he,
fight to preserve the hope of
others who depend on you.$k$pOne hopes—that is, I hope—that you
will take great care and let me battle
with you. I can't stand any more loss.
Shall we converse? Perhaps over tea.
Oh! My word, these brushes with others.
When one's brother sets the standard, all men fall short of the mark.
I beg of you—don't stray from my side.
